alert.note: Alert for Blount; Knox; Roane; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 2:22PM CDT until August 07 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Blount, Jefferson, Knox, Loudon, Roane and Sevier. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended. However, minor flooding is ongoing due to runoff. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Sevierville, Clinton, Alcoa, Farragut, Louisville, Rockford, Strawberry Plains, Halls, Blaine, Bearden, Powell, Lake Forest, Karns, Maloneyville, Mascot, Kimberlin Heights and House Mountain State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
